line.comment: * This script defines what the AI needs in terms of ships, both civilian and military.
* Note that military fleets get reinforced only when they are in "retreat mode". In this mode, they will go to the nearest safe Outpost and wait for full reinforcement while defending the sector.
* ==== COMPANY SHIPS ===
* Instant build.
* Works only for Traders, all other potential Workers ignored.
* Mercenaries.
* === SQUADRONS ====
* If $race does not own any Outpost, it's useless to go on.
* Yakis don't build Police ships.
* ***DEBUG
* Zero Hour: do not reinforce members of a Coordinated Invasion

* 0/ Reinforce carriers that are in need of fighters (one-time order). TODO Once a support dies, it never got replaced (not a *big* problem... also, there is a carrier check in !move.follow.template -> CheckDock:).
* -- This part has been deactivated because fighters, as defined in Mayhem.Template.Squadrons, are already designed to go inside the carriers when Mayhem.Squadron.Add is called on them.
* -- Note that fighters that already are in a squadron as followers frequently check if there's a carrier available in !move.follow.template.
* ReinforceCarriers:
* 1/ Check if each of our squadron is full, or if it's in need of reinforcements.
* ***DEBUG
* Make sure this fleet does not ask for more ships if no building are in progress for it.
* We ignore ships being built here (ie. not already in the squadron), to make possible reinforcements during operation (more fun!).
* ***DEBUG

line.text: ' thinks that its currently getting reinforcements from: '

line.comment: * If we already have a ship being built for this squadron, we don't build anything more.
* If we don't do that, we have no way of telling if this squadron is being reinforced or not, and the AI would potentially build several un-needed ships in several Outposts.
* Get $homebase that will be building the next reinforcements.
* 3.15: Instead of looking for the closest safe Outpost, we take all near Outposts and take the one that is 1/ unclaimed 2/ has the least backlog items.
* *^^^ try to spread your order more and avoid creating large backlogs
* ***DEBUG
* *** Zero HOur: move this here so that the script can keep up with the high ingame demand. (order as much in one go as you can, except super large capitals)
* *^^^ entirely avoid Outposts with too large backlog. (it will eventually get cleared)
* $closeOutposts.queue = $backlog.s
* ^^ do not compare these Outposts, just choose one with a small backlog
* $class = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.GetRandomElement' : array=$classes
* Zero Hour: removed the M7 class
* 3.15: don't add a massive amount of ship orders at once.
* Zero Hour: disabled
* if $qty >= 12
* $qty = $qty / 3
* else if $qty >= 4
* $qty = $qty / 2
* end
* ***DEBUG
* 2/ Check our global needs in squadrons.
* Order a single ship without leader to create a new squadron.
* Composition being automatically set in Mayhem.Squadron.Add, any squadron starts with an M3.
* Zero Hour mod
* Choose the leader's homebase. $outposts is randomized above.
* Shared resources is off, we must make sure that the (random) outpost is able to craft what we need.
* === WORKERS ====
* Check if we need any more workers, build 1 by 1.
* We don't want to build Traders if we have no clients in range.
* Is there a trading station?
* Is our neighbour a friend?
* Build the ship (only one at a time). Always build the ship at station sector's outpost.
* Check if we are not already building the ship.
* Check also if there is no worker of the same assignment waiting for template.

sval.val: Argon
entering the reinforcing script routine
Argon
thinks it is full strength
Argon
thinks that its currently getting reinforcements from:
Argon
found
Outposts in range
Argon
needs
and has chosen
This script defines what the AI needs in terms of ships, both civilian and military.
Note that military fleets get reinforced only when they are in "retreat mode". In this mode, they will go to the nearest safe Outpost and wait for full reinforcement while defending the sector.
==== COMPANY SHIPS ===
Instant build.
Works only for Traders, all other potential Workers ignored.
=== SQUADRONS ====
If $race does not own any Outpost, it's useless to go on.
Yakis don't build Police ships.
Zero Hour: do not reinforce members of a Coordinated Invasion

0/ Reinforce carriers that are in need of fighters (one-time order). TODO Once a support dies, it never got replaced (not a *big* problem... also, there is a carrier check in !move.follow.template -> CheckDock:).
-- This part has been deactivated because fighters, as defined in Mayhem.Template.Squadrons, are already designed to go inside the carriers when Mayhem.Squadron.Add is called on them.
-- Note that fighters that already are in a squadron as followers frequently check if there's a carrier available in !move.follow.template.
1/ Check if each of our squadron is full, or if it's in need of reinforcements.
Make sure this fleet does not ask for more ships if no building are in progress for it.
We ignore ships being built here (ie. not already in the squadron), to make possible reinforcements during operation (more fun!).
If we already have a ship being built for this squadron, we don't build anything more.
If we don't do that, we have no way of telling if this squadron is being reinforced or not, and the AI would potentially build several un-needed ships in several Outposts.
Get $homebase that will be building the next reinforcements.
3.15: Instead of looking for the closest safe Outpost, we take all near Outposts and take the one that is 1/ unclaimed 2/ has the least backlog items.
*^^^ try to spread your order more and avoid creating large backlogs
*** Zero HOur: move this here so that the script can keep up with the high ingame demand. (order as much in one go as you can, except super large capitals)
*^^^ entirely avoid Outposts with too large backlog. (it will eventually get cleared)
$closeOutposts.queue = $backlog.s
^^ do not compare these Outposts, just choose one with a small backlog
$class = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.GetRandomElement' : array=$classes
Zero Hour: removed the M7 class
3.15: don't add a massive amount of ship orders at once.
Zero Hour: disabled
if $qty >= 12
$qty = $qty / 3
else if $qty >= 4
$qty = $qty / 2
2/ Check our global needs in squadrons.
Order a single ship without leader to create a new squadron.
Composition being automatically set in Mayhem.Squadron.Add, any squadron starts with an M3.
Zero Hour mod
Choose the leader's homebase. $outposts is randomized above.
Shared resources is off, we must make sure that the (random) outpost is able to craft what we need.
=== WORKERS ====
Check if we need any more workers, build 1 by 1.
We don't want to build Traders if we have no clients in range.
Is there a trading station?
Is our neighbour a friend?
Build the ship (only one at a time). Always build the ship at station sector's outpost.
Check if we are not already building the ship.
Check also if there is no worker of the same assignment waiting for template.
